scenarioDescription:
The GJ 536 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 536 is a star with 0.52 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.5 times its radius. It is located 33.95 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 536 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 536 system


GJ 536 b

GJ 536 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2017-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 536 b is 5.361 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 536 b is 2.170 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 536 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system GJ 536, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: GJ 536 - System With 1 Exoplanet
